Interesting, I get voices about pyramids too, and I have a copper pyramid 
that hangs from my workroom cieling. It's lined with aluminum foil, and has 
a quartz sphere in the apex. I used to use it as the echo box, and still 
have a speaker mounted in it. The pyramid was part of a larger meditation 
pyamid, over six feet tall, but I only use the top, made of 3/4 inch copper 
pipe. Hmmm, wonder if I need a pyramidal enlosure for the system?

Frank

>Nice find Frank, I'm sure that kit would do the the job coupled to a motor 
>which in turn is coupled to the tuning dial of a radio. Maybe there is 
>enough random information to do a simple sweep, the radio signals are 
>constantly modulated with changing information. The part that has got me 
>thinking is how some of the voices drag across several different stations 
>and sound like the same voice. At first thought it appears to have 
>something to do with amplitude variation and time. I can sometimes get the 
>'dragging voice' effect using EVP maker, it is not nearly as clean as the 
>radio method. I have to look through my stuff in the basement, I think I 
>may have a Delco auto-tuning car radio from about 1970 that was mechanical.
>I'm attaching a reverse playback message from today.
>"Pyramids helpful.....That's a secret"
